a:5:{s:1:"d";a:4:{i:0;O:8:"stdClass":47:{s:9:"short_des";N;s:10:"article_id";s:4:"7332";s:12:"article_type";s:12:"publications";s:3:"uri";s:28:"asean-digital-community-2040";s:8:"pub_type";s:1:"1";s:5:"title";s:28:"ASEAN Digital Community 2040";s:11:"posted_date";s:10:"2023-02-02";s:11:"posted_year";s:4:"2023";s:12:"posted_month";s:1:"2";s:7:"content";s:1539:"<!DOCTYPE html>
<html>
<head>
</head>
<body>
<p style="text-align: justify;">Digital transformation (DX) is one of the most crucial innovations to have changed modern life over the last decade. The number of annual installations of industrial robots worldwide has more than doubled. Technological revolutions have led to unprecedented changes in <em>what</em> and <em>how</em> we trade. The Association of Southeast Asian Nations (ASEAN) is on track to grow its digital community, with a rising number of internet users and greater internet penetration. However, one of the main concerns in the growing DX era is the digital divide within and across countries including in ASEAN, which is reflected in the gaps in internet speed, usage, and technology production amongst ASEAN Member States. Other challenges in DX are privacy, cybersecurity, and competition concerns. The ASEAN Chairmanship in 2023 could address several DX challenges to move towards the vision of a thriving ASEAN Digital Community by 2040 through implementing ASEAN commitments, improving the quality of key digital enablers for digital technology adoption, enhancing countries&rsquo; preparedness for digital transformation, and improving the quality of privacy and competition laws to address the costs and risks of DX.</p>
<p class="pdf" style="text-align: justify;"><a href="http://www.eria.org/uploads/media/policy-brief/FY2022/ASEAN-Digital-Community-2040.pdf" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">ASEAN Digital Community 2040</a></p>
</body>
</html>";s:10:"image_name";s:43:"/uploads/publications/logo63f5957a073f4.jpg";s:9:"video_url";s:0:"";s:4:"tags";s:31:"Innovation and Technology,ASEAN";s:6:"editor";s:0:"";s:6:"author";s:26:"Lili Yan Ing, Ivana Markus";s:6:"doc_no";s:0:"";s:6:"period";s:4:"2023";s:14:"article_status";s:1:"0";s:10:"event_time";s:0:"";s:5:"venue";s:0:"";s:5:"major";s:0:"";s:16:"article_keywords";s:0:"";s:9:"organizer";s:0:"";s:12:"image_name_2";s:0:"";s:10:"start_date";s:10:"2023-02-02";s:8:"end_date";s:10:"0000-00-00";s:8:"keywords";s:2797:"ASEAN Digital Community 2040 ASEAN Digital Community 2040 Digital transformation (DX) is one of the most crucial innovations to have changed modern life over the last decade. The number of annual installations of industrial robots worldwide has more than doubled. Technological revolutions have led to unprecedented changes in what and how we trade. The Association of Southeast Asian Nations (ASEAN) is on track to grow its digital community, with a rising number of internet users and greater internet penetration. However, one of the main concerns in the growing DX era is the digital divide within and across countries including in ASEAN, which is reflected in the gaps in internet speed, usage, and technology production amongst ASEAN Member States. Other challenges in DX are privacy, cybersecurity, and competition concerns. The ASEAN Chairmanship in 2023 could address several DX challenges to move towards the vision of a thriving ASEAN Digital Community by 2040 through implementing ASEAN commitments, improving the quality of key digital enablers for digital technology adoption, enhancing countries&rsquo; preparedness for digital transformation, and improving the quality of privacy and competition laws to address the costs and risks of DX.
ASEAN Digital Community 2040 Innovation and Technology,ASEAN  Lili Yan Ing,Ivana Markus  2023  asean    2023-02-02  2023-02-02 2 February 2023 3202 yraurbeF 2 20-20-3202  20-20-3202    naesa  3202  sukraM anavI,gnI naY iliL  NAESA,ygolonhceT dna noitavonnI 0402 ytinummoC latigiD NAESA
.XD fo sksir dna stsoc eht sserdda ot swal noititepmoc dna ycavirp fo ytilauq eht gnivorpmi dna ,noitamrofsnart latigid rof ssenderaperp ;ouqsr&seirtnuoc gnicnahne ,noitpoda ygolonhcet latigid rof srelbane latigid yek fo ytilauq eht gnivorpmi ,stnemtimmoc NAESA gnitnemelpmi hguorht 0402 yb ytinummoC latigiD NAESA gnivirht a fo noisiv eht sdrawot evom ot segnellahc XD lareves sserdda dluoc 3202 ni pihsnamriahC NAESA ehT .snrecnoc noititepmoc dna ,ytirucesrebyc ,ycavirp era XD ni segnellahc rehtO .setatS rebmeM NAESA tsgnoma noitcudorp ygolonhcet dna ,egasu ,deeps tenretni ni spag eht ni detcelfer si hcihw ,NAESA ni gnidulcni seirtnuoc ssorca dna nihtiw edivid latigid eht si are XD gniworg eht ni snrecnoc niam eht fo eno ,revewoH .noitartenep tenretni retaerg dna sresu tenretni fo rebmun gnisir a htiw ,ytinummoc latigid sti worg ot kcart no si )NAESA( snoitaN naisA tsaehtuoS fo noitaicossA ehT .edart ew woh dna tahw ni segnahc detnedecerpnu ot del evah snoitulover lacigolonhceT .delbuod naht erom sah ediwdlrow stobor lairtsudni fo snoitallatsni launna fo rebmun ehT .edaced tsal eht revo efil nredom degnahc evah ot snoitavonni laicurc tsom eht fo eno si )XD( noitamrofsnart latigiD 0402 ytinummoC latigiD NAESA 0402 ytinummoC latigiD NAESA";s:9:"published";s:1:"1";s:9:"highlight";s:1:"0";s:8:"order_id";s:3:"100";s:12:"created_date";s:19:"2023-02-02 10:56:36";s:13:"modified_date";s:19:"2023-02-22 04:09:30";s:11:"modified_by";s:2:"15";s:7:"old_url";N;s:10:"majorEmail";N;s:9:"education";N;s:10:"experience";N;s:12:"publications";N;s:6:"others";N;s:13:"presentations";N;s:7:"feature";N;s:11:"sub_experts";s:1:"1";s:15:"sub_dep_experts";N;s:13:"meta_keywords";s:0:"";s:16:"meta_description";s:0:"";s:5:"sc_id";s:1:"0";s:15:"thumbnail_image";N;}i:1;O:8:"stdClass":47:{s:9:"short_des";N;s:10:"article_id";s:4:"7331";s:12:"article_type";s:12:"publications";s:3:"uri";s:106:"aseans-role-in-the-threat-of-global-economic-decoupling-implications-from-geographical-simulation-analysis";s:8:"pub_type";s:1:"1";s:5:"title";s:115:"ASEANâ€™s Role in the Threat of Global Economic Decoupling: Implications from Geographical Simulation Analysis";s:11:"posted_date";s:10:"2023-02-02";s:11:"posted_year";s:4:"2023";s:12:"posted_month";s:1:"2";s:7:"content";s:1673:"<!DOCTYPE html>
<html>
<head>
</head>
<body>
<p style="text-align: justify;">&nbsp;The war between Russia and Ukraine since February 2022 has triggered renewed concerns about global economic decoupling. Although the face-to-face meeting between the United States and China leaders in November 2022 agreed to continue the dialogue, it is premature to assert that progress has begun in the direction of avoiding decoupling. We used the geographical simulation model (IDE/ERIA-GSM) to examine the possible economic impacts of global economic decoupling on the Association of Southeast Asian Nations (ASEAN). We define decoupling as policy changes that raise barriers to trade in goods and services and firms&rsquo; responses to these changes. If policy decoupling occurs despite the efforts of economic agents, the global economy is negatively affected. ASEAN has a relative advantage through positive trade diversion effects if it does not join any of the groups. Adherence to a rules-based international trade order will ultimately benefit ASEAN Member States and people. ASEAN should demonstrate ASEAN centrality and show the world its efforts to avoid decoupling. It should also avoid participating in decoupling if it occurs.</p>
<p class="pdf" style="text-align: justify;"><a href="https://test-www-eria-org.azurewebsites.net/uploads/media/policy-brief/FY2022/ASEAN%E2%80%99s-Role-in-the-Threat-of-Global-Economic-Decoupling-Implications-from-Geographical-Simulation-Analysis..pdf" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">ASEAN&rsquo;s Role in the Threat of Global Economic Decoupling: Implications from Geographical Simulation Analysis</a></p>
</body>

Although the face-to-face meeting between the United States and China leaders in November 2022 agreed to continue the dialogue, it is premature to assert that progress has begun in the direction of avoiding decoupling. We used the geographical simulation model (IDE/ERIA-GSM) to examine the possible economic impacts of global economic decoupling on the Association of Southeast Asian Nations (ASEAN). We define decoupling as policy changes that raise barriers to trade in goods and services and firms&rsquo; responses to these changes. If policy decoupling occurs despite the efforts of economic agents, the global economy is negatively affected. ASEAN has a relative advantage through positive trade diversion effects if it does not join any of the groups. Adherence to a rules-based international trade order will ultimately benefit ASEAN Member States and people. ASEAN should demonstrate ASEAN centrality and show the world its efforts to avoid decoupling. It should also avoid participating in decoupling if it occurs.

yletamitlu lliw redro edart lanoitanretni desab-selur a ot ecnerehdA .spuorg eht fo yna nioj ton seod ti fi stceffe noisrevid edart evitisop hguorht egatnavda evitaler a sah NAESA .detceffa ylevitagen si ymonoce labolg eht ,stnega cimonoce fo stroffe eht etipsed srucco gnilpuoced ycilop fI .segnahc eseht ot sesnopser ;ouqsr&smrif dna secivres dna sdoog ni edart ot sreirrab esiar taht segnahc ycilop sa gnilpuoced enifed eW .)NAESA( snoitaN naisA tsaehtuoS fo noitaicossA eht no gnilpuoced cimonoce labolg fo stcapmi cimonoce elbissop eht enimaxe ot )MSG-AIRE/EDI( ledom noitalumis lacihpargoeg eht desu eW .gnilpuoced gnidiova fo noitcerid eht ni nugeb sah ssergorp taht tressa ot erutamerp si ti ,eugolaid eht eunitnoc ot deerga 2202 rebmevoN ni sredael anihC dna setatS detinU eht neewteb gniteem snoitacilpmI :gnilpuoceD cimonocE labolG fo taerhT eht ni eloR s™€âNAESA sisylanA noitalumiS lacihpargoeG morf snoitacilpmI :gnilpuoceD cimonocE labolG fo taerhT eht ni eloR s™€âNAESA";s:9:"published";s:1:"1";s:9:"highlight";s:1:"0";s:8:"order_id";s:3:"100";s:12:"created_date";s:19:"2023-02-02 10:41:51";s:13:"modified_date";s:19:"2023-02-22 03:37:41";s:11:"modified_by";s:2:"15";s:7:"old_url";N;s:10:"majorEmail";N;s:9:"education";N;s:10:"experience";N;s:12:"publications";N;s:6:"others";N;s:13:"presentations";N;s:7:"feature";N;s:11:"sub_experts";s:1:"1";s:15:"sub_dep_experts";N;s:13:"meta_keywords";s:0:"";s:16:"meta_description";s:0:"";s:5:"sc_id";s:1:"0";s:15:"thumbnail_image";N;}i:2;O:8:"stdClass":47:{s:9:"short_des";N;s:10:"article_id";s:4:"7328";s:12:"article_type";s:12:"publications";s:3:"uri";s:134:"reframing-of-global-strategies-and-regional-cooperation-pathways-for-an-inclusive-net-zero-strategy-in-the-energy-transition-framework";s:8:"pub_type";s:1:"1";s:5:"title";s:134:"Reframing of Global Strategies and Regional Cooperation Pathways for an Inclusive Net-Zero Strategy in the Energy Transition Framework";s:11:"posted_date";s:10:"2023-02-02";s:11:"posted_year";s:4:"2023";s:12:"posted_month";s:1:"2";s:7:"content";s:1225:"<!DOCTYPE html>
<html>
<head>
</head>
<body>
<p style="text-align: justify;">As carbon dioxide emission reductions become increasingly urgent to counter climate change, many nations have announced net-zero emissions targets. Achieving a net-zero economy will require the decarbonisation of electricity generation, massive expansion of low-carbon energy systems, and investment in net-zero-carbon technologies. These adjustments must consider the existing energy, economic, and social development imperatives of advanced and developing countries, while encouraging regional cooperation. This brief assesses energy transition challenges for the Association of Southeast Asian Nations and the Gulf Cooperation Council (GCC), and proposes new policy pathways towards an inclusive global net-zero economy.</p>
<p class="pdf" style="text-align: justify;"><a href="http://www.eria.org/uploads/media/policy-brief/FY2022/Reframing-of-Global-Strategies-and-Regional-Cooperation-Pathways-for-an-Inclusive-Net-Zero-Strategy.pdf" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">Reframing of Global Strategies and Regional Cooperation Pathways for an Inclusive Net-Zero Strategy in the Energy Transition Framework</a></p>
</body>
</html>";s:10:"image_name";s:43:"/uploads/publications/logo63f5954515eed.jpg";s:9:"video_url";s:0:"";s:4:"tags";s:27:"Energy,Climate Change,ASEAN";s:6:"editor";s:0:"";s:6:"author";s:284:"Fachry Abdul Razak Afifi, Venkatachalam  Anbumozhi, Dongmei Chen, Alin Halimaussadiah, Vida Hardjono, Roes E.G. Lufti, Dian Lutfiana, Julio Mauricio, Alloysius Joko Purwanto, Prof. Widodo Wahyu Purwanto, Jitendra Roychoudhury, Citra Endah Nur Setyawati, Majed Al Suwailem, Wing T. Woo";s:6:"doc_no";s:0:"";s:6:"period";s:4:"2023";s:14:"article_status";s:1:"0";s:10:"event_time";s:0:"";s:5:"venue";s:0:"";s:5:"major";s:0:"";s:16:"article_keywords";s:0:"";s:9:"organizer";s:0:"";s:12:"image_name_2";s:0:"";s:10:"start_date";s:10:"2023-02-02";s:8:"end_date";s:10:"0000-00-00";s:8:"keywords";s:2971:"Reframing of Global Strategies and Regional Cooperation Pathways for an Inclusive Net-Zero Strategy in the Energy Transition Framework Reframing of Global Strategies and Regional Cooperation Pathways for an Inclusive Net-Zero Strategy in the Energy Transition Framework As carbon dioxide emission reductions become increasingly urgent to counter climate change, many nations have announced net-zero emissions targets. Achieving a net-zero economy will require the decarbonisation of electricity generation, massive expansion of low-carbon energy systems, and investment in net-zero-carbon technologies. These adjustments must consider the existing energy, economic, and social development imperatives of advanced and developing countries, while encouraging regional cooperation. This brief assesses energy transition challenges for the Association of Southeast Asian Nations and the Gulf Cooperation Council (GCC), and proposes new policy pathways towards an inclusive global net-zero economy.
Reframing of Global Strategies and Regional Cooperation Pathways for an Inclusive Net-Zero Strategy in the Energy Transition Framework Energy,Climate Change,ASEAN  Fachry Abdul Razak Afifi,Venkatachalam  Anbumozhi,Dongmei Chen,Alin Halimaussadiah,Vida Hardjono,Roes E.G. Lufti,Dian Lutfiana,Julio Mauricio,Alloysius Joko Purwanto,Prof. Widodo Wahyu Purwanto,Jitendra Roychoudhury,Citra Endah Nur Setyawati,Majed Al Suwailem,Wing T. Woo  2023  asean    2023-02-02  2023-02-02 2 February 2023 3202 yraurbeF 2 20-20-3202  20-20-3202    naesa  3202  ooW .T gniW,meliawuS lA dejaM,itawayteS ruN hadnE artiC,yruhduohcyoR ardnetiJ,otnawruP uyhaW ododiW .forP,otnawruP okoJ suisyollA,oiciruaM oiluJ,anaiftuL naiD,itfuL .G.E seoR,onojdraH adiV,haidassuamilaH nilA,nehC iemgnoD,ihzomubnA  malahcatakneV,ififA kazaR ludbA yrhcaF  NAESA,egnahC etamilC,ygrenE krowemarF noitisnarT ygrenE eht ni ygetartS oreZ-teN evisulcnI na rof syawhtaP noitarepooC lanoigeR dna seigetartS labolG fo gnimarfeR
.ymonoce orez-ten labolg evisulcni na sdrawot syawhtap ycilop wen sesoporp dna ,)CCG( licnuoC noitarepooC fluG eht dna snoitaN naisA tsaehtuoS fo noitaicossA eht rof segnellahc noitisnart ygrene sessessa feirb sihT .noitarepooc lanoiger gnigaruocne elihw ,seirtnuoc gnipoleved dna decnavda fo sevitarepmi tnempoleved laicos dna ,cimonoce ,ygrene gnitsixe eht redisnoc tsum stnemtsujda esehT .seigolonhcet nobrac-orez-ten ni tnemtsevni dna ,smetsys ygrene nobrac-wol fo noisnapxe evissam ,noitareneg yticirtcele fo noitasinobraced eht eriuqer lliw ymonoce orez-ten a gniveihcA .stegrat snoissime orez-ten decnuonna evah snoitan ynam ,egnahc etamilc retnuoc ot tnegru ylgnisaercni emoceb snoitcuder noissime edixoid nobrac sA krowemarF noitisnarT ygrenE eht ni ygetartS oreZ-teN evisulcnI na rof syawhtaP noitarepooC lanoigeR dna seigetartS labolG fo gnimarfeR krowemarF noitisnarT ygrenE eht ni ygetartS oreZ-teN evisulcnI na rof syawhtaP noitarepooC lanoigeR dna seigetartS labolG fo gnimarfeR";s:9:"published";s:1:"1";s:9:"highlight";s:1:"0";s:8:"order_id";s:3:"100";s:12:"created_date";s:19:"2023-02-01 16:53:17";s:13:"modified_date";s:19:"2023-02-22 04:08:37";s:11:"modified_by";s:2:"15";s:7:"old_url";N;s:10:"majorEmail";N;s:9:"education";N;s:10:"experience";N;s:12:"publications";N;s:6:"others";N;s:13:"presentations";N;s:7:"feature";N;s:11:"sub_experts";s:1:"1";s:15:"sub_dep_experts";N;s:13:"meta_keywords";s:0:"";s:16:"meta_description";s:0:"";s:5:"sc_id";s:1:"0";s:15:"thumbnail_image";N;}i:3;O:8:"stdClass":47:{s:9:"short_des";N;s:10:"article_id";s:4:"7292";s:12:"article_type";s:12:"publications";s:3:"uri";s:92:"facilitating-global-trade-and-investment-and-leveraging-value-added-in-downstream-industries";s:8:"pub_type";s:1:"1";s:5:"title";s:92:"Facilitating Global Trade and Investment and Leveraging Value Added in Downstream Industries";s:11:"posted_date";s:10:"2023-01-10";s:11:"posted_year";s:4:"2023";s:12:"posted_month";s:1:"1";s:7:"content";s:1185:"<!DOCTYPE html>
<html>
<head>
</head>
<body>
<p style="text-align: justify;">Despite facing global uncertainties, Indonesia has achieved macroeconomic stability, supported by strong responses in fiscal and monetary policy, as well as robust domestic supply chains. By using its natural resources and following the global trend of green industries, Indonesia aims to become a key player in the global renewable energy market. Sound infrastructure is one of the key requirements to attract high-profile investments, but Indonesia struggles with poor and unequal infrastructure. Cumbersome bureaucracy and restrictiveness towards services trade also hinder the nation from reaching its potential. Strengthening physical, human, and institutional infrastructure will help the country secure investments and boost trade</p>
<p class="pdf"><a title="PB-2022-07" href="https://test-www-eria-org.azurewebsites.net/uploads/source/Facilitating-Global-Trade-and-Investment-and-Leveraging-Value-Added-in-Downstream-Industries.pdf" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">Facilitating Global Trade and Investment and Leveraging Value Added in Downstream Industries</a></p>
</body>
</html>";s:10:"image_name";s:89:"/uploads/publications/20230110/facilitating-global-trade-and-investment-website-cover.jpg";s:9:"video_url";s:0:"";s:4:"tags";s:22:"ASEAN,Investment,Trade";s:6:"editor";s:0:"";s:6:"author";s:36:"Raihan M. Ramadhan,Pyan Amin Muchtar";s:6:"doc_no";s:0:"";s:6:"period";s:4:"2023";s:14:"article_status";s:1:"0";s:10:"event_time";s:0:"";s:5:"venue";s:0:"";s:5:"major";s:0:"";s:16:"article_keywords";s:0:"";s:9:"organizer";s:0:"";s:12:"image_name_2";s:0:"";s:10:"start_date";s:10:"2023-01-10";s:8:"end_date";s:10:"0000-00-00";s:8:"keywords";s:2275:"Facilitating Global Trade and Investment and Leveraging Value Added in Downstream Industries Facilitating Global Trade and Investment and Leveraging Value Added in Downstream Industries Despite facing global uncertainties, Indonesia has achieved macroeconomic stability, supported by strong responses in fiscal and monetary policy, as well as robust domestic supply chains. By using its natural resources and following the global trend of green industries, Indonesia aims to become a key player in the global renewable energy market. Sound infrastructure is one of the key requirements to attract high-profile investments, but Indonesia struggles with poor and unequal infrastructure. Cumbersome bureaucracy and restrictiveness towards services trade also hinder the nation from reaching its potential. Strengthening physical, human, and institutional infrastructure will help the country secure investments and boost trade
Facilitating Global Trade and Investment and Leveraging Value Added in Downstream Industries ASEAN,Investment,Trade  Raihan M. Ramadhan,Pyan Amin Muchtar  2023  Indonesia    2023-01-10  2023-01-10 10 January 2023 3202 yraunaJ 01 01-10-3202  01-10-3202    aisenodnI  3202  rathcuM nimA nayP,nahdamaR .M nahiaR  edarT,tnemtsevnI,NAESA seirtsudnI maertsnwoD ni deddA eulaV gnigareveL dna tnemtsevnI dna edarT labolG gnitatilicaF
edart tsoob dna stnemtsevni eruces yrtnuoc eht pleh lliw erutcurtsarfni lanoitutitsni dna ,namuh ,lacisyhp gninehtgnertS .laitnetop sti gnihcaer morf noitan eht rednih osla edart secivres sdrawot ssenevitcirtser dna ycarcuaerub emosrebmuC .erutcurtsarfni lauqenu dna roop htiw selggurts aisenodnI tub ,stnemtsevni eliforp-hgih tcartta ot stnemeriuqer yek eht fo eno si erutcurtsarfni dnuoS .tekram ygrene elbawener labolg eht ni reyalp yek a emoceb ot smia aisenodnI ,seirtsudni neerg fo dnert labolg eht gniwollof dna secruoser larutan sti gnisu yB .sniahc ylppus citsemod tsubor sa llew sa ,ycilop yratenom dna lacsif ni sesnopser gnorts yb detroppus ,ytilibats cimonoceorcam deveihca sah aisenodnI ,seitniatrecnu labolg gnicaf etipseD seirtsudnI maertsnwoD ni deddA eulaV gnigareveL dna tnemtsevnI dna edarT labolG gnitatilicaF seirtsudnI maertsnwoD ni deddA eulaV gnigareveL dna tnemtsevnI dna edarT labolG gnitatilicaF";s:9:"published";s:1:"1";s:9:"highlight";s:1:"0";s:8:"order_id";s:3:"100";s:12:"created_date";s:19:"2023-01-09 16:39:52";s:13:"modified_date";s:19:"2023-01-31 04:23:19";s:11:"modified_by";s:1:"1";s:7:"old_url";N;s:10:"majorEmail";N;s:9:"education";N;s:10:"experience";N;s:12:"publications";N;s:6:"others";N;s:13:"presentations";N;s:7:"feature";N;s:11:"sub_experts";s:1:"1";s:15:"sub_dep_experts";N;s:13:"meta_keywords";s:0:"";s:16:"meta_description";s:0:"";s:5:"sc_id";s:1:"0";s:15:"thumbnail_image";N;}}s:1:"g";a:0:{}s:1:"e";O:8:"DateTime":3:{s:4:"date";s:26:"2023-03-07 05:48:40.302288";s:13:"timezone_type";i:3;s:8:"timezone";s:13:"Europe/Berlin";}s:1:"m";N;s:1:"c";N;}
